articles.author: Yu Xie, Carolina Mandl
articles.description: Country Garden's (2007.HK) deal with creditors for an extension on onshore debt payments worth 3.9 billion yuan ($536 million) boosted shares in the developer on Monday and gave China's crisis-ridden property sector some much-needed respite.
articles.title: Country Garden debt deal, China property support moves trigger relief rally

articles.author: Amy-Jo Crowley, Pablo Cerqueiro, Milana Vinn
articles.description: Barclays Plc (BARC.L) is exploring the sale of a stake in the unit that processes payments for UK merchants as the British bank seeks a partner to help grow the business, four people familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Barclays explores sale of stake in $2.5 billion UK payments unit – sources

articles.author: Maggie Fick
articles.description: Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) launched its weight-loss injection Wegovy in Britain on Monday, its second debut in Europe in just over a month as the drugmaker seeks to expand in the region even as it struggles to keep up with soaring demand.
articles.title: Novo Nordisk launches weight-loss drug Wegovy in Britain

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China is launching a campaign to revive its lagging stock market, and boost investor confidence in an ailing economy.
articles.title: Factbox: How China is trying to boost its stock market

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Continental (CONG.DE) will integrate Google Cloud services into its vehicle cockpit system, the company said on Monday, enabling drivers to ask the vehicle for assistance such as context on nearby sights or information on the vehicle while driving.
articles.title: Continental integrates Google Cloud into vehicle cockpit

articles.author: Shariq Khan
articles.description: Americans could face a sticker shock with their heating bills this winter, especially if it is a chilly one, due to unusually low U.S. stockpiles of distillate fuels following OPEC+ crude supply cuts and higher demand from Europe, analysts said.
articles.title: Low US heating oil stockpiles could cause winter sticker shocks

articles.author: Josh Ye
articles.description: Mobile app stores in China run by Tencent Holdings (0700.HK), Xiaomi (1810.HK) and others have started to bar app publishers from launching new apps if they do not make all the disclosures required by authorities, documents seen by Reuters showed.
articles.title: Tencent, others begin enforcing China's new oversight move on apps

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan will try to convince Kremlin chief Vladimir Putin to return to a Ukraine grain export deal that helped ease a global food crisis, when the two leaders meet in Russia's Black Sea resort of Sochi on Monday.
articles.title: With grain deal in focus, Putin to meet Erdogan in Russia

articles.author: Aftab Ahmed, Krishn Kaushik, Rajesh Prabhuswamy
articles.description: Deeper and more entrenched divisions over Russia's war in Ukraine risk derailing progress on issues such as food security, debt distress and global cooperation on climate change when the world's most powerful nations meet this weekend in New Delhi.
articles.title: Ukraine war, absence of Putin and Xi set to dent G20 summit

articles.author: Sachin Ravikumar
articles.description: Hundreds more school buildings in England might be crumbling and unsafe, Britain's education minister said on Monday, after authorities ordered 104 schools to shut buildings with old and weak concrete.
articles.title: Hundreds more UK school buildings could be crumbling, says minister
